alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Northern Blaine County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 7:24PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Blaine County through 815 PM MDT... At 723 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Harlem, or 18 miles east of Chinook, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harlem, Fort Belknap, Hogeland, and Zurich. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
